item.title: WHO declares Africa free of polio
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday declared that Africa was free of the virus that causes polio, a landmark in a decades-long campaign to eradicate the notorious disease around the world.

item.title: Duterte's wish for Morales the 'humanitarian way' to say 'you're fired' -Sotto
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte's wish for Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president Ricardo Morales to resign for health reasons is the "humanitarian way" of sacking the state insurer's top executive, Senate President Vicente Sotto III said on Tuesday.

item.title: UST teases virtual campus tour
item.description: With the traffic on campus limited due to the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic, students of the centuries-old university came up with the UST Minecraft Campus Tour.

item.title: Bohol province records 23 new COVID-19 cases
item.description: Bohol has recorded 23 new coronavirus disease (COVID-19) infections on Tuesday, a record high for the province since the pandemic began.

item.title: Amerikanong arkitekto, napasok sa negosyong pagkain kasama ang Pinay na nobya
item.description: Isang arkitekto sa Amerika si Paul Bradford Neal, pero nang abutan siya ng lockdown sa Tondo, Maynila, nagbukas sila ng kaniyang Pinay na nobyo ng Mexican food cart business.

item.title: Locsin rejects suggestion for a PCG attaché in Beijing
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. on Tuesday rejected the idea of having a Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) attaché in the Beijing Embassy amid rising tensions with China over the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Thousands of Swedes got false positive COVID-19 result due to test kit fault
item.description: About 3,700 people in Sweden were told in error that they had the coronavirus due to a fault in a COVID-19 testing kit from China, the Public Health Agency said on Tuesday.

item.title: Sawa na sumabit sa poste ng kuryente, nagdulot ng blackout sa Malabon
item.description: Nabalot ng dilim ang isang lugar sa Malabon nang sumabog ang linya ng kuryente dahil sa malaking sawa na sumabit sa poste. Pero hindi raw ito ang unang pagkakataon na may nakitang sawa sa kanilang lugar.

item.title: Driver, nagulantang nang makitang may patay sa kaniyang sasakyan
item.description: Laking gulat at takot ng isang driver at kaniyang kasama nang makita nilang may bangkay ng lalaki na inilagay sa loob ng kanilang nakaparadang sasakyan sa Asingan, Pangasinan.

item.title: India charges 19, including 7 Pakistanis, over 2019 Kashmir bombing
item.description: India's National Investigation Agency (NIA) charged 19 people, including 7 Pakistani nationals, on Tuesday over a deadly bomb attack on a security convoy in the Indian-controlled part of Kashmir last year.

item.title: Senate performing its oversight duty on COVID-19 funds -lawmakers
item.description: The Senate has been responsible in exercising its oversight function, several senators said Tuesday after President Rodrigo Duterte implored them to create committees they deemed best suited to monitor for any irregularity in the spending of COVID-19 response funds.

item.title: Livelihood loans na hanggang P1M para sa grupo ng mga OFW, inihahanda ng OWWA
item.description: Magkakaloob umano ang Overseas Workers Welfare Administration (OWWA) ng livelihood loans sa mga grupo ng overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) na naapektuhan ng COVID-19 pandemic, ayon kay administrator Hans Leo Cacdac.

item.title: QC eyes September opening for COVID-19 testing lab
item.description: The Quezon City government is looking to open its molecular and diagnostics laboratory for coronavirus testing in September once it receives accreditation from the Department of Health (DOH).The local government wants operations to start in September with an initial testing capacity of 500 samples daily.

item.title: Jolo blasts not a direct threat to Eastern Mindanao, says EastMinCom spox
item.description: The twin explosions that rocked Jolo, Sulu on Monday are not seen as a direct threat to Eastern Mindanao, the spokesman of the Eastern Mindanao Command (Eastmincom) said on Tuesday.

item.title: Bato: Jolo blasts should open eyes of anti-terror law critics
item.description: Senator Ronald "Bato" Dela Rosa on Tuesday said the recent bombing attacks in Jolo, Sulu should make critics of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 think twice about their opposition to the measure.
